title: How to solve new brew doctor warnings about name issues formulae?
body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: The following formulae have the same name as core formulae:
  pothosware/pothos/airspyhf
  pothosware/pothos/limesuite
  pothosware/pothos/soapyhackrf
  pothosware/pothos/soapyremote
  pothosware/pothos/soapyrtlsdr
  pothosware/pothos/soapysdr
You will need to use their full names throughout Homebrew.
```

### Verification

- [x] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.4.21-44-ga496f4e
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: a496f4eecfd629fd6db4b1fd9d6f796e7b319598
Last commit: 7 hours ago
Branch: master
Core tap HEAD: 2fda887d0428e02bd5eade73204db25d922b6636
Core tap last commit: 28 minutes ago
Core tap JSON: 19 Feb 15:03 UTC
Core cask tap HEAD: 58edaaa43e9ebe9c2848fc89021c512692719802
Core cask tap last commit: 51 minutes ago
Core cask tap JSON: 19 Feb 15:03 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY: /private/tmp/com.apple.launchd.RdoGD9K4sy/org.xquartz:0
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE: set
HOMEBREW_SORBET_RUNTIME: set
Homebrew Ruby: 3.3.7 => /opt/homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/3.3.7/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 16.0.0 build 1600
Git: 2.48.1 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 8.7.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 14.7-arm64
CLT: 16.2.0.0.1.1733547573
Xcode: 16.2
Rosetta 2: false
```

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Have a brew installation without brew doctor warnings.

### What happened (include all command output)?

Brew doctor brought up new warnings and it is unclear how to solve those.

### What did you expect to happen?

No warnings or a hint how I can solve the warnings.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
brew doctor
```
